jobs_results.title: Staff IOS Engineer
jobs_results.description:
Yassir is the leading super App in the Maghreb region set to changing the way daily services are provided. It currently operates in 45 cities across Algeria, Morocco and Tunisia with recent expansions into France, Canada and Sub-Saharan Africa. It is backed (:$200M in funding) by VCs from Silicon Valley, Europe and other parts of the world.

We offer on-demand services such as ride-hailing and last-mile delivery. Building on this infrastructure, we are now introducing financial services to help our users pay, save and borrow digitally.

Helping usher the continent into a digital economy era. We‚Äôre not just about serving people - we‚Äôre about creating a marketplace to bring people what they need while infusing social values.

About Your Role

As an iOS Staff Engineer, you will drive the technical standards for the iOS applications across our consumer domain, working with multiple squads inside the domain. You will lead iOS engineers with tech roadmaps, architecture decisions, and feature development and release cycles. You will mentor junior developers. You will contribute to scaling up iOS engineers in multiple squads and bringing great talents on board by conducting technical interviews.

Your role as iOS Staff Engineer
‚Ä¢ Design, build and maintain features for the domain applications
‚Ä¢ Provide technical leadership and manage dependencies
‚Ä¢ Conduct design and code reviews
‚Ä¢ Help the domain team members with technical blockers supporting them and helping them grow
‚Ä¢ Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize efficiency
‚Ä¢ Participate in architecture and design discussions
‚Ä¢ Participate strongly in building the technical roadmap
‚Ä¢ Conduct technical interviews
‚Ä¢ Help Improving engineering standards, tooling, and processes

About Your Experience
‚Ä¢ BSc/MSc in Engineering, Computer Science or relevant field
‚Ä¢ At least 10 years of industry experience 5 years of which in iOS mobile development with Swift
‚Ä¢ Mastery of Swift
‚Ä¢ Strong foundation in programming fundamentals
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills
‚Ä¢ Enjoy solving problems and helping others meet their goals
‚Ä¢ Solid understanding of the full mobile development lifecycle
‚Ä¢ Substantial experience with Git in a team environment
‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with mobile DevOps CI/CD tools
‚Ä¢ Experience working with different architectures
‚Ä¢ Experience writing testable code and unit tests
‚Ä¢ Have published many iOS applications to the Store
‚Ä¢ Experience in a fast-growing startup in a the on-demand services space is a plus

Why you should join Yassir?

üòé You will be part of one of the first Algerian startups to go through the Y Combinator program and one of the fastest-growing tech companies in North Africa. We are current in +30 cities (Algeria, Tunisia, Morocco, Senegal, France and Germany)

üí∏ Attractive salary and you even get a stake in the company

üöâ Subsidized public transit pass

ü§ôüèΩHave a lasting impact on our company's culture

üöÄ Perfect timing with renowned investors to build something great

üìà Extremely steep learning curve with own responsibility and intensive guidance

üíØ Make a real impact on the world by helping us bring affordable financial and on-demand services to millions of Africans

At Yassir, we believe in the power of diversity and the importance of an inclusive culture. So, if you're ready to bring your unique perspective and experiences to the table, then we're excited to listen.

Don't just apply for a job, come and be a part of our journey. Let's create a better tomorrow together.

We look forward to receiving your application!

Best of luck,

Your Yassir TA Team

jobs_results.title: Senior Native Mobile App Developer (Offshore)
jobs_results.description:
Senior Native Mobile App Developer (Offshore)
‚Ä¢ Location: Offshore/Remote
‚Ä¢ Working Hours: UK business hours, 9am-5pm, Mon-Fri, weekly
‚Ä¢ Pay Rate: Up to ¬£2000 GBP per month, fixed
‚Ä¢ Employment Type: Full-time Freelance Contract (40hrs per week)
‚Ä¢ Language Requirements: Must be fluent in English both verbally & in writing
‚Ä¢ Start Date: January 2025 start
‚Ä¢ Project Duration: 6+ months (estimated), high likelihood of renewal

About Handyman Interactive

We are an innovative software development firm dedicated to partnering with our clients to build specialised engineering teams tailored for startups and SMEs/SMBs. Our technology-first approach ensures that we meet the bespoke needs of each client by delivering game-changing solutions. We are looking for a dedicated Senior Native Mobile App Developer to join our remote team.

Role Overview

This role is perfect for an experienced developer who excels in both native iOS development using Swift and native Android development using Java. The role involves working closely with stakeholders to gather and clarify requirements, demonstrating working software, and serving as a senior or lead mobile developer within a team-oriented environment.

Key Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Develop, implement, and maintain high-quality native mobile applications for iOS and Android platforms.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate directly with stakeholders to elicit and clarify requirements, ensuring a clear understanding of project goals.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrate working software to stakeholders, incorporating feedback into iterative development.
‚Ä¢ Take the lead in mobile development projects, ensuring alignment with industry best practices, and guide less experienced team members.
‚Ä¢ Contribute to the continuous improvement of software development processes.
‚Ä¢ Participate in code reviews, providing and receiving constructive feedback.
‚Ä¢ Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in mobile app development to ensure forward-thinking solutions.

Key Requirements
‚Ä¢ 5+ years of comprehensive experience in native mobile app development, with expertise in both Swift for iOS and Java for Android.
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to engage with stakeholders effectively and translate business requirements into clear technical specifications.
‚Ä¢ Exceptional ability to deliver high-quality software within deadlines.
‚Ä¢ Fluent proficiency in English, both written and verbal.
‚Ä¢ Ability and willingness to work within UK timezone business hours.
‚Ä¢ Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive mindset towards challenges.

What Handyman Interactive Offers
‚Ä¢ A supportive and dynamic work environment.
‚Ä¢ Engagement in exciting projects that innovate and drive business success.
‚Ä¢ Remote work flexibility as a full-time freelancer, set at 40 hours per week.
‚Ä¢ Competitive pay of up to ¬£2000 per month, fixed.

Join our offshore freelance team and contribute to projects that are making a real difference through innovation in mobile technology!

jobs_results.title: Senior iOS Developer (Swift)
jobs_results.description:
As a Senior iOS Developer (Swift) you are already shaping what the future holds!

As a pioneer in digital health our heart beats for the development and implementation of new technologies. For the next level of eHealth evolution we are looking for creative minds who enjoy working with a variety of technologies, their own design freedom and professional development.
Contribute to our success by:
Perform thorough analyses of functional and non-functional requirements and provide clean and reliable technical solutions. Translate system requirements into task specifications for less experienced developers
Provide end-to-end delivery of components/subsystems (requirements clarification, implementation, testing, integration, deployment, documentation) by applying agreed best practices and the project software development processes
Depending on the team structure, lead a small team (2-3 people) in order to implement components and subsystems.
Collaborate closely with other members of the team and maintain positive client (stakeholders) interactions.
Provide constructive feedback.
Contribute to the overall company in culture building, teamwork, and positivity

Qualifications:
Strong knowledge of Object-oriented and functional programming paradigms
Strong knowledge of specific iOS architectural design patterns (MVC, MVVM+C, MVP, VIPER)
Strong knowledge of both Objective C and Swift programming languages
Strong knowledge of framework-based development, and dependency managers (Cocoapods, Carthage, Swift Package manager)
Strong knowledge of UIKit (e.g. Autolayout, Size classes etc.) and custom UI components
Strong experience with persistence solutions (CoreData, SQLite, CouchDB, Realm)
Strong experience in working with RESTful APIs to connect iOS applications to back-end services
Strong knowledge of iOS software tools (Xcode IDE, Instruments, iOS Simulators)
Strong knowledge in writing multi-threaded, asynchronous code, in GCD and NSOperations advaced usage
Strong knwoledge in iOS memory management
Strong experience in using Version Control (Git, GitHub,BitBucket, Gitlab etc)
Strong experience in writing Unit and UI automation tests
Solid understanding of the mobile development life cycle
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Real passion for quality, performance and attention to detail

Be part of it now!Synchronizing Healthcare

jobs_results.title: Mobile developer - Part time
Computer Scientist (m/f/d) as App Developer for iOS / Android
jobs_results.description:
Computer Scientist (m/f/d) as App Developer for iOS / Android
RIWA - All geoinformation becomes a digital experience

RIWA GmbH is a leading company in the field of geoinformation and municipal specialist processes with over 25 years of experience and market leader in Bavaria. Our team develops innovative solutions for the digital transformation of cities and municipalities, in particular through geographic information systems (GIS). We also create digital twins of municipalities for construction planning, energy management and sustainable urban development. We offer customized solutions and attach great importance to close cooperation.

Become part of our team in one of our branches in Augsburg, Memmingen or Kempten im Allg√É¬§u. After training, you can also work from home.
These are your tasks
‚Ä¢ Further development of our native RIWA GIS Android app
‚Ä¢ Implementation of our previous apps for Apple iOS with Kotlin & Compose Multiplatform
‚Ä¢ Quality assurance through code reviews, unit tests and automated test procedures
‚Ä¢ Technical conceptualization of functional requirements from product management
‚Ä¢ Advising product management on development issues
You know your way around this
‚Ä¢ Completed studies in computer science or equivalent training
‚Ä¢ Sound knowledge in the development of Android apps (Kotlin, Java, Android SDK). Basic knowledge of iOS development advantageous (Swift)
‚Ä¢ Ideally experience with Jetpack Compose, Kotlin Multiplatform and Compose Multiplatform
‚Ä¢ Expertise with automated tests, CI/CD processes and agile software development
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of designing appealing user interfaces is a plus
‚Ä¢ Independent working style, ability to work in a team and a high level of self-motivation
What we offer you
‚Ä¢ A great team - #GernePerDu - and a varied job in the office and home office
‚Ä¢ Attractive salary, 13 monthly salaries, capital-forming benefits and a performance bonus
‚Ä¢ Family-friendly working time models with flexible working hours (flexitime)
‚Ä¢ Corporate benefits such as a job bike, drinks flat rate or employee discounts with over 1,500 providers
‚Ä¢ Intensive training in the field of activity and regular further training
‚Ä¢ An exciting environment with varied tasks
‚Ä¢ A secure, modern workplace close to the city center with future prospects
Have we piqued your interest?

Please send us your complete application documents directly online via our applicant management system, stating your salary expectations and the earliest possible starting date.
RIWA GmbH

An der Neum√É¬ºhle 5, 87700 Memmingen
Everyone is welcome at RIWA. Diversity and equal opportunities are an integral part of our company. We see the uniqueness of each individual, and therefore the diversity of our teams, as the driving force behind our daily work and innovations. - We look forward to meeting you.

+

jobs_results.title: Mobile Developer
jobs_results.description:
This a Full Remote job, the offer is available from: Romania

Affirma Consulting, a young, fast paced, award winning tech company ranked one of the "Top 5 Best Mid-Size Companies to Work For" by the Seattle Business magazine, is looking for a Mobile Developer with a passion for people and coding to join our internal Custom Development team.

This is a great opportunity to join a growing organization that focuses on creating cutting edge, inhouse technical solutions for large to enterprise level clients. In this role you will engage with stakeholders and global team members to flush out project needs, drive development and ensure client satisfaction.

Requirements:
‚Ä¢ 2+ years of experience with React Native
‚Ä¢ Experience with common web frameworks like React, Vue, or Angular
‚Ä¢ High attention to detail on visual design and polish
‚Ä¢ Strong with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS
‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of object-oriented programming
‚Ä¢ General knowledge of API development and databases
‚Ä¢ Experience using automated build pipelines
‚Ä¢ Ability to take ownership of features, seeing them through from tasks definition, development, and testing
‚Ä¢ BS Degree in Computer Science or equivalent

Why Affirma?
‚Ä¢ One of Washington's Fastest Growing Private Companies & Top 100 Best Companies to Work For (According to Seattle Business Magazine and Puget Sound Business Journal)
‚Ä¢ Casual environment, surrounded by incredibly intelligent and motivated co-workers, and a performance-driven culture
‚Ä¢ Flexible Schedule
‚Ä¢ Opportunity for growth
‚Ä¢ Great location, great people, exciting projects, and tons of fun.

Affirma is an award-winning consultancy specializing in Mobile, Cloud, Business Intelligence, SharePoint, Technology Infrastructure, Custom Development, Visual Design, and Staffing Services. We focus on delivering true, measurable business value to our clients. We have top industry customer satisfaction and are dedicated to delivering dependable and reliable solutions that exceed client expectations. Affirma's motto is quality solutions on budget, on time, every time.

Affirma is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not make employment decisions or otherwise discriminates based on race, creed, color, national origin, sex, military status, sexual orientation, or the presence of any sensory, mental, or physical disability, genetic information, or any other category protected by law.

jobs_results.title: Senior Android Developer
Developer Support Engineer
jobs_results.description:
About us:

RevenueCat makes building, analyzing, and growing mobile subscriptions easy. We launched as part of Y Combinator's summer 2018 batch and today are handling more than $4B of in-app purchases annually across thousands of apps.

We are a mission driven, remote-first company that is building the standard for mobile subscription infrastructure. Top apps like ChatGPT, VSCO, Notion, and ClassDojo count on RevenueCat to power their subscriptions at scale.

Our 80 team members (and growing!) are located all over the world, from San Francisco to Madrid to Taipei. We're a close-knit, product-driven team, and we strive to live our core values: Customer Obsession, Always Be Shipping, Own It, and Balance.

The Role

If you‚Äôre looking to jumpstart your career in tech and have a direct impact on apps used by billions of end-users, the Developer Support Engineer (DSE) role at RevenueCat is a fantastic opportunity. This is one of the few entry-level positions we offer, and it has proven to be an incredible stepping stone‚Äîour current Support Lead, a Product Manager, and a Technical Account Manager each started out as DSEs.

In this role, you‚Äôll help developers integrate the RevenueCat SDK into their apps, troubleshoot tricky edge cases, and unlock new possibilities in subscription monetization. You‚Äôll provide hands-on support for some of the biggest apps in the world‚Äîimagine helping the teams behind ChatGPT, VSCO, PhotoRoom, Notion, and others get the best out of RevenueCat. You‚Äôll be empowered to own the support experience, build out internal tools, and identify improvements that shape how developers everywhere use RevenueCat.

In 2024, our DSEs spoke at conferences in Berlin, Logro√±o, New York, London, and Tokyo. This is optional, but if you're interested, you can meet RevenueCat customers face to face, have fun working our booth, and share your knowledge with developers worldwide.

What you‚Äôll be responsible for
‚Ä¢ Supporting developers daily. You‚Äôll debug issues, untangle complex code paths, and guide developers through onboarding so they can ship subscription features confidently.
‚Ä¢ Collaborating cross-functionally. You‚Äôll partner closely with Engineering and Product to influence the developer experience‚Äîeverything from our documentation to new features.
‚Ä¢ Building tooling and processes. You‚Äôll craft or improve the internal apps and dashboards that make troubleshooting faster and easier, both for you and your teammates.
‚Ä¢ Driving user success. From investigating stack traces to clarifying best practices, you‚Äôll ensure developers can move from ‚Äúblocked‚Äù to ‚Äúshipped‚Äù without missing a beat.

Within your first month, you‚Äôll:
‚Ä¢ Deep-dive into the frustrations and roadblocks developers face, helping them get unblocked so they can launch their apps.
‚Ä¢ Familiarize yourself with our support tools and processes.
‚Ä¢ Propose and implement quick wins in our documentation and support articles to reduce common developer pitfalls.
‚Ä¢ Work alongside our engineering team to resolve complex issues and learn the ins and outs of subscription infrastructure.

Within your first 3 months, you‚Äôll:
‚Ä¢ Spot opportunities for product improvements that will reduce developer friction.
‚Ä¢ Build out test apps and reproducible environments to tackle issues head-on.
‚Ä¢ Own onboarding and solution engineering for new developers using RevenueCat, providing a seamless start-to-finish experience.

Within your first 6 months, you‚Äôll:
‚Ä¢ Identify recurring blockers and implement targeted improvements‚Äîboth in our products and in your own support workflows.
‚Ä¢ Craft (and refine) internal dashboards and tooling that accelerate the DSE team‚Äôs efficiency.
‚Ä¢ Make meaningful, self-directed contributions to how we scale support for an ever-growing developer community.

After 12 months, you‚Äôll have:
‚Ä¢ Gained super-hero level intuition for diagnosing the root causes of even the trickiest tickets.
‚Ä¢ Led the charge on hiring, mentoring, and growing our support engineering team.
‚Ä¢ Found new ways to delight developers, turning frustrating subscription problems into smooth, joyful experiences.

About you
‚Ä¢ You‚Äôre eager to learn and grow; this is one of the few entry-level positions at RevenueCat and has historically launched multiple careers within our company.
‚Ä¢ You have 2-3 years of experience in an engineering or technical role, or have built and shipped a mobile app that integrates RevenueCat.
‚Ä¢ You‚Äôre comfortable with either iOS (Swift / Objective-C) or Android (Java / Kotlin) and have a grasp of app development and release processes.
‚Ä¢ You can debug code with minimal info, diagnosing issues from cryptic logs or stack traces.
‚Ä¢ You thrive in an environment that requires creative problem-solving and a ‚Äúget it done‚Äù mentality.
‚Ä¢ You have strong written and verbal communication skills, and you‚Äôre empathetic towards the developer journey.

What you‚Äôll need to be successful
‚Ä¢ Technical curiosity and a willingness to learn new tools and frameworks.
‚Ä¢ Resourcefulness in figuring out solutions when the path isn‚Äôt obvious.
‚Ä¢ Clear communication skills to translate complex issues into helpful, actionable steps.
‚Ä¢ Outcome-oriented mindset, ensuring your support leads to measurable developer success‚Äîfewer tickets, better documentation, and happier customers.
‚Ä¢ Collaboration and comfort with a fully remote, asynchronous setup using tools like Slack, Zoom, Linear, and Notion.

What we offer:
‚Ä¢ $112,000 USD Salary regardless of your location
‚Ä¢ Competitive equity in a fast-growing, Series B startup backed by top tier investors including Y Combinator
‚Ä¢ 10 year window to exercise vested equity options
‚Ä¢ Fully remote work environment that promotes autonomy and flexibility
‚Ä¢ Suggested 4 to 5 weeks time off to recharge and focus on mental, physical, and emotional health
‚Ä¢ $2,000 USD to build your personal workspace
‚Ä¢ $1,000 USD annual stipend for your continuous learning and growth

Curious about the interview process? Discover more in our blog post about how we hire and learn tips to help you succeed.

jobs_results.title: Senior IOS Engineer
jobs_results.description:
This a Full Remote job, the offer is available from: Tanzania, Turkey, Ukraine, Bulgaria, Albania, Romania, Russia, Senegal, Nigeria, Serbia

Yassir is the leading super App in the Maghreb region set to changing the way daily services are provided. It currently operates in 45 cities across Algeria, Morocco and Tunisia with recent expansions into France, Canada and Sub-Saharan Africa. It is backed (~$200M in funding) by VCs from Silicon Valley, Europe and other parts of the world.
We offer on-demand services such as ride-hailing and last-mile delivery. Building on this infrastructure, we are now introducing financial services to help our users pay, save and borrow digitally.
Helping usher the continent into a digital economy era. We‚Äôre not just about serving people - we‚Äôre about creating a marketplace to bring people what they need while infusing social values.

About the role
‚Ä¢ We are looking for a senior iOS developer to join our tech hub in Berlin and support our growth and expansion. You will be part of the engineering team, working with a high-quality code base and the latest tools, where you will promote your skills to be an expert in complex frontend development in iOS (swift). Your primary focus will be the development of mobile applications and their integration with back-end services. You will be working alongside other engineers and developers working on different layers of the infrastructure.
About your role as a iOS mobile developer
‚Ä¢ Design and build mobile applications using iOS (swiftUI) platform.
‚Ä¢ Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with a team to define, design, and ship new features
‚Ä¢ Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs
‚Ä¢ Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization
‚Ä¢ Participate in brainstorming sessions and contribute ideas to our technology, algorithms and products.
‚Ä¢ Work with the engineering and design teams to understand end-user requirements, formulate use cases, and then translate that into a pragmatic and effective technical solution
‚Ä¢ Dive into difficult problems and successfully deliver results on schedule
About your experience
‚Ä¢ Must have technical skills with at least 4 years of experience
‚Ä¢ Language: iOS (swift) native
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with cloud message APIs and push notification
‚Ä¢ Web architecture: Rest and restful APIs, micro-services
‚Ä¢ Version control: GIT
‚Ä¢ Nice to have technical skills (Strongly advised)
‚Ä¢ Containers: Docker, kubernetes
‚Ä¢ Caching, Redis server
‚Ä¢ Scaling, Web load balancing
‚Ä¢ Experience in a rapidly growing company in the mobility, on-demand or fintech space is a plus
‚Ä¢ BSc/MSc in Engineering, Computer Science or relevant field
Why you should join Yassir
‚Ä¢ üòé You will be part of one of the first Algerian startups to go through the Y Combinator program and one of the fastest-growing tech companies in North Africa. We are current in +30 cities (Algeria, Tunisia, Morocco, Senegal, France and Germany)
‚Ä¢ üí∏ Attractive salary and you even get a stake in the company
‚Ä¢ üöâ Subsidized public transit pass
‚Ä¢ ü§ôüèΩHave a lasting impact on our company's culture
‚Ä¢ üöÄ Perfect timing with renowned investors to build something great
‚Ä¢ üìà Extremely steep learning curve with own responsibility and intensive guidance
‚Ä¢ üíØ Make a real impact on the world by helping us bring affordable financial and on-demand services to millions of AfricansAt Yassir, we believe in the power of diversity and the importance of an inclusive culture. So, if you're ready to bring your unique perspective and experiences to the table, then we're excited to listen.

Don't just apply for a job, come and be a part of our journey. Let's create a better tomorrow together.

We look forward to receiving your application!

Best of luck,
Your Yassir TA Team

jobs_results.title: Flutter Mobile Developer
jobs_results.description:
This a Full Remote job, the offer is available from: Europe, Portugal

The role is restricted to those physically located in Europe, while this is a remote position, we cannot consider candidates that are not based in such region. Preference will be given to candidates based in Portugal, Spain or Malta.

We are looking for an enthusiastic Flutter Mobile Developer to help maintain and develop our sports mobile applications.
‚Ä¢ As a Flutter Mobile Developer you are expected to ‚Ä¶
‚Ä¢ Write clean, well-documented, and maintainable code for Flutter application
‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain technical documentation for the applications
‚Ä¢ Identify the causes of the most complex issues and implement practical and efficient technical solutions
‚Ä¢ Implement both backend and front-end features
‚Ä¢ Coordinate with UX/UI designers, developers, and test engineers in an Agile environment
‚Ä¢ Abide by industry and company software development standards
‚Ä¢ Conduct code reviews and give feedback to other developers
‚Ä¢ Understand the big picture and offer insightful advice about technologies and projects
‚Ä¢ Be proactive in identifying and communicating potential risks and issues to the team and stakeholders
‚Ä¢ Participate in sprint planning, estimation, and retrospective meetings
‚Ä¢ Keep up-to-date with the latest mobile app development trends and technologies
‚Ä¢ Work in close partnership with cross-functional teams and management
‚Ä¢ Ensure code quality by writing tests, using SonarQube, etc.
‚Ä¢ Success in this role means...
‚Ä¢ Collaborating towards a team effort to improve the overall user experience of our applications.
‚Ä¢ Developing DRY, clean, maintainable and scalable code that can be comprehended and worked on solely through documentation created.
‚Ä¢ Increasing the performance, scalability and security of our mobile applications.
‚Ä¢ You have acquired proficient communication skills in the English language through team collaboration.
